data.Sentence_cn: 可爱的怪人
data.Sentence: --- lesson 31  A lovable eccentric

data.Sentence_cn: 真正古怪的人从不有意引人注意。
data.Sentence: True eccentrics never deliberately set out to draw attention to themselves.

data.Sentence_cn: 他们不顾社会习俗，意识不到自己所作所为有什么特殊之处。
data.Sentence: They disregard social conventions without being conscious that they are doing anything extraordinary.

data.Sentence_cn: 他们总能赢得别人的喜爱与尊敬，因为他们给平淡单一的日常生活增添了色彩。
data.Sentence: This invariably wins them the love and respect of others, for they add colour to the dull routine of everyday life.

data.Sentence_cn: 理查德.科尔森生前是我们镇上最有名望的人之一。
data.Sentence: Up to the time of his death, Richard Colson was one of the most notable figures in our town.

data.Sentence_cn: 他是个精明能干、有钱的商人，但镇上大部分人对他生活中的这一个方面几乎一无所知。
data.Sentence: He was a shrewd and wealthy businessman, but most people in the town hardly knew anything about this side of his life.

data.Sentence_cn: 大家都管他叫迪基。早在他去世前很久，他的古怪行为就成了传奇故事了。
data.Sentence: He was known to us all as Dickie and his eccentricity had become legendary long before he died.

data.Sentence_cn: 迪基痛恨势利小人。
data.Sentence: Dickie disliked snobs intensely.

data.Sentence_cn: 尽管他有一辆豪华小轿车，但却很少使用，常常喜欢以步代车。
data.Sentence: Though he owned a large car, he hardly ever used it, preferring always to go on foot.

data.Sentence_cn: 即使大雨倾盆，他也总是拒绝带伞。
data.Sentence: Even when it was raining heavily, he refused to carry an umbrella.

data.Sentence_cn: 一天，他遇上一场瓢泼大雨，淋得透湿。
data.Sentence: One day, he walked into an expensive shop after having been caught in a particularly heavy shower.

data.Sentence_cn: 他走进一家高级商店，要为妻子买一块价值300英镑的手表。
data.Sentence: He wanted to buy a £300 watch for his wife,

data.Sentence_cn: 但店员见他浑身泥水的样子，竟不肯接待他。
data.Sentence: but he was in such a bedraggled condition that an assistant refused to serve him.

data.Sentence_cn: 迪基二话没说就走了。一会儿，他带着一个大布口袋回到店里。
data.Sentence: Dickie left the shop without a word and returned carrying a large cloth bag.

data.Sentence_cn: 布袋很沉，他重重地把布袋扔在柜台上。
data.Sentence: As it was extremely heavy, he dumped it on the counter.

data.Sentence_cn: 店员让迪基走开，他置之不理，并要求见经理。
data.Sentence: The assistant asked him to leave, but Dickie paid no attention to him and requested to see the manager.

data.Sentence_cn: 经理认出了这位顾客，表示了深深的歉意，还严厉地训斥了店员。
data.Sentence: Recognizing who the customer was, the manager was most apologetic and reprimanded the assistant severely.

data.Sentence_cn: 店员为迪基拿出了那块手表，迪基把布口袋递给他，
data.Sentence: When Dickie was given the watch, he presented the assistant with the cloth bag.

data.Sentence_cn: 口袋里面装着300镑的便士。
data.Sentence: It contained £300 in pennies.

data.Sentence_cn: 他坚持要店员点清那些硬币后他才离去。这些硬币加在一起共有30,000枚！
data.Sentence: He insisted on the assistant's counting the money before he left -- 30,000 pennies in all!

data.Sentence_cn: 还有一次，他邀请一些著名评论家来参观他私人收藏的现代画。
data.Sentence: On another occasion, he invited a number of important critics to see his private collection of modern paintings.

data.Sentence_cn: 这次展览引起报界广泛注意，
data.Sentence: This exhibition received a great deal of attention in the press,

data.Sentence_cn: 因为这些画名义上是名家的作品，事实上是迪基自己画的。
data.Sentence: for though the pictures were supposed to be the work of famous artists, they had in fact been painted by Dickie.

data.Sentence_cn: 他花了4年时间策划这出精心设计的闹剧，只是想证明评论家们有时并不解他们所谈论的事情。
data.Sentence: It took him four years to stage this elaborate joke simply to prove that critics do not always know what they are talking about.
